refentryinfo.title: xdg-icon Manual
refentryinfo.releaseinfo: This is release 0.5 of the xdg-icon Manual.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The xdg-icon program can be used to install icons into the desktop icon system for use in menu entries, as desktop icons or as file icon.
The desktop icon system works according to the XDG Icon Theme Specification at http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/icon-theme--spec

listitem.simpara: Postpone updating the desktop icon system. If multiple icons are added in sequence this flag can be used to indicate that additional changes will follow and that it is not necassery to update the desktop icon system right away.
Installs or removes the icon file as part of theme. The default theme is hicolor.
Installs or uninstalls the icon for the current user only.
Installs or uninstalls the icon for all users on the system. Usually only root is allowed to do this.

Specifies the context for the icon. Icons to be used in the application menu and as desktop icon should use apps as context. Icons to be used as file icons should use mimetypes as context. Other common contexts are actions, devices, emblems, filesystems and stock.

Specifies the size of the icon (for png and xpm icons only). All icons must be square. Common sizes for icons in the apps context are: 16, 22, 32, 48, 64 and 128. Common sizes for icons in the mimetypes context are: 16, 22, 32, 48, 64 and 128

Installs the icon file indicated by icon-file to the desktop icon system. The icon file must have the .png, .xpm or .svg as extension. If a corresponding .icon file exists in the same location as icon-file it will be installed as well.
Removes the icon file indicated by icon-file from the desktop icon system.
Force an update of the desktop icon system. This is only useful if the last call to xdg-icon included the --noupdate option.
